author: {'steamid': '76561198399608746', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1706389509}
review:
very cute and very charming

been meaning to try this for a while, 8~ years since release i finally do it lmao

only a couple hours long if you're kinda dumb like i am, but even then i didn't have to look anything up to solve it like some other puzzle games i've played, i also find it funny how the one who composed the music in this game is the same guy that composed for PAYDAY and GTFO. quite the contrast, but it goes to show how much variety Viklund has and how much attention to detail he shows in his work. adaptive soundtracks might my favorite thing in games, and pan-pan shows one of the best examples of adaptive music i've seen.

10/10. grab this if its on sale for sure, but i wouldn't mind paying full for it. it may be short but its a quality couple of hours, which are a rarity these days

author: {'steamid': '76561197970365782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1701827346}
review:
It's cute and sounds nice, but by the end of even the short play through the annoyances were piling up. Just poor design choices that ended up dragging things out. Things like:

1. Dropping items is not obvious and there is no screen or creature to consult
2. Controlling the camera was nice, but more than once I missed a key moment because it happened off screen. Which is doubly odd, because scripted cameras were also present.
3. Sometimes you need to move away from an object to make something happen. For instance, I'd put an object on a pedestal and expect something to happen, only to have nothing happen. So I'd pick it up and go looking for alternatives. Little did I know, if I'd left the object and then moved far enough away, an event would trigger then. Nothing like getting a puzzle correct, only to be rewarded with nothing and the real puzzle becomes fidgeting.
4. The switches on the tower is very poor design. I don't mind messing with something to figure out how it works, but making me run up and down the tower to test an idea is a literal waste of time. I just brought up a guide.

In the end the game is far more obtuse than challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130518188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1702678019}
review:
*Slams mug down onto table* ANOTHER!! I WOULD LIKE ANOTHER!
I need a Pan Pan 2! Or something similar! It is a short game about 30 min to an hour max but it was the perfect length to fit into my busy schedule and feel like I accomplished something. The art is beautiful and the puzzles are JUST challenging enough where your mind stays engaged and you forget about the rest of your life for the whole duration but not so challenging you get frustrated. It is also hard to get frustrated when all the sounds, characters and movements are so cute. 
This game helped me unwind and it was the perfect cozy game to play where it was not too easy where it gets boring but not too hard where it stresses you out more than relaxes you. The only thing I would say is to not overthink some things too much and trust that the developers gave you everything you need to solve it in terms of hints, objects, patterns etc.

Thank you so much for creating this game! I really needed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051261898', 'num_games_owned': 872, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1701017699}
review:
I feel badly about this, because a lot of love obviously went into this game, but I just can't recommend it. I probably could have given it more of a chance, but after 20 minutes, I just felt no desire to keep playing, and I really wanted to like it. It's style is really cute, and the colors are bright and fun. But it's just not fun. The controls for M/K were not great, you can't drop stuff you've picked up, the puzzles are either extremely easy or so obfuscated I don't know what I'm supposed to even be doing, the 'story' is so unclear I was mostly guessing, and the environmental storytelling felt more like someone relying on the fact that there is an environment that could maybe tell a story if you fill in most of the blanks yourself. 

I got it on sale a while back so I'm not too fussed about what I spent, because it certainly didn't feel worth 20 USD, (though, to be fair, I don't know how long the game is), especially when the game crashed because I went up to a save station and hit the no option. I know games are expensive to make, and I like to support indie devs, but come on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198295383552', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1698446840}
review:
I would recommend this game if it's on sale.
Pros (don't worry, no spoilers):
- Atmospheric music fits the cute art style
- Has a layer of progression that entices the player to continue to play
- Puzzles introduced are creative
Cons:
- Puzzle difficulty is inconsistent with no real bridge between the two. There a few easier puzzles and a few harder puzzles, but nothing in between.
- The price is way too high for the playtime. Similar to Donut County, $20 for a game that can be completed in ~4h on average is just way too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070780289', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1647679154}
review: A wonderful and relaxing puzzle experience wrapped in an excellent aesthetic. It's not a long game, but it's a great experience. I picked it up randomly and played it in a night, and I had a lovely time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069327345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1662779814}
review: As far as I can tell (on admittedly scanty evidence), this is a fake open-world game that's actually linear. I went to the mines, solved the puzzle, and the cutscene after leaving didn't trigger because...? I don't know, because I didn't solve the puzzle in the way they expected? Some hidden prereq? Not a fan of "read the developers' minds" as a puzzle, which is seemingly the requirement here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239922912', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 357, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1660073652}
review:
Pan-Pan was a short and sweet game, with simple, but lovely, graphics. The game only took me just over 2 hours to complete, and I did so all in one sitting, which is good for this game in my opinion, as it seems the system for saving is fully manual without any autosaving.

Our character crashes in their flying balloon ship and now has to find the parts to repair it, which was so kindly indicated by three random hooded creatures with big mustaches. Majority of the game consists of memory and pressure based puzzles that are quite simple once you understand what you are supposed to do, but the game fails to guide you in any direction, so it will take you awhile to figure out. You can rotate the camera which is very important because clues could be on the walls, I myself didn't notice that I could rotate the camera until I was stuck.

I'm rating this game as recommended, as for the most part it is a beautifully crafted, delightful game. To mark it as not recommended would be like kicking a puppy. But be wary of getting to figure out everything by yourself, as there is no hints in the game, and if in doubt, definitely wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185350542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1639204427}
review:
Very cute and lovely game! Excellently made, beautiful art and music. 
But it has some cons.
-Way too expensive for its length. I finished it in only an hour and a half. Definitely not worth 13 bucks.
-Confusing. Lots of puzzles seem to make little sense and I only solved them by trial and error. The solutions made sense in hindsight but I never would've figured it out through reasoning, there isn't enough to go off of. Also, I only figured out how to drop items near the end, completely by accident. (So I went through the whole game thinking I couldn't drop items lol)

Overall I really liked this game. It would've been amazing as part of something longer.
I do not recommend for full price, but definitely worth buying on sale, which is what I did :) I think I only paid 2 dollars for it.

Honestly I must have been to stupid to solve these puzzles, because I had to search for a walkthrough to get through these puzzles.

Also itÂ´s really short, so you can finish the game within an hour. If youÂ´re not stupid like me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117812405', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1668028902}
review:
If laboratories could chemically produce the purest form of wholesome and cute, this game wouldn't quite be it, but very, very close.
I love the art style, the sound design is amazing, and game mechanics have a surprising amount of detail and depth.
The game is a bit short, but your first playthrough will have you scratching your head at a few points.

Overall really great game, I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199213168617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1634066311}
review:
Full disclosure: I have only started playing these puzzle games in the past week, so I thought this game, which doesn't have any walkthroughs or tutorials, was incredibly difficult. So, I played while looking at a guide. Nevertheless, I did enjoy playing it and pulling off the instruction. Of course, the art style and aesthetic that pulled me in did entertain my eyes all throughout the game. That part I can say I 100% love. It was adorable. 
Really grateful I could play this kind of wonderfully programmed and illustrated game for such a discounted price.
I recommend this for someone who wants a game that'll make them think while also being able to appreciate the visuals

author: {'steamid': '76561199077529668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1628620230}
review:
I want to preface this by saying that I don't recommend this game at full price, but if you can get this game on sale for cheap and it looks like your thing, go for it.

I really wish I enjoyed this game more; the visuals are adorable and the sound design is excellent. When the puzzles are good they're *really* good but quite often the puzzles are too obscure or have logic that is hard to follow. This isn't helped by the fact that the game is completely wordless so requires you to recognise which symbols aren't just decoration, and then to interpret the symbols' meaning correctly. I feel the game is made even more confusing by the fact that it begins as if it is open world and can be completed in any order, however in truth it is incredibly linear and most puzzles must be solved in a specific sequence with lots of backtracking.

That all being said, if you think you'll enjoy the game, get it while it's on sale and give it a go, the visuals are cute and some of the puzzles are good. It's just held back by some unfortunate design flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119222410', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1624107908}
review:
This game was purchased for me as a gift. 

This was a cute short puzzle game which I found really fun. The whole game is set in a single map which is slowly opened up by completing puzzles. I would quite like to see these developers make another larger version of this game.  

Only issue I had with it was figuring out how to put objects down; it is not indicated how you do this and it's not entirely obvious in my opinion. You have to click and hold on the object your holding until a circle appears on the floor and then let go.

Not sure I would have spent Â£10 on it as it is very short but it's Â£4.99, the price that it was on sale for when i wrote this review, is reasonable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257614339', 'num_games_owned': 3231, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1623363649}
review:
It's a short sweet game where you will be left in a game without any tutorial.

first time that I played it on my old laptop, I kinda hate it cause I didn't knew what I was supposed to do and didn't made any progress.

the second time it was different and there was no single puzzle that got me stuck and got me thinking too much.

I think I wasn't in the mood to be calm and pay attention to every beautiful detail of this game.

the game is around less than an hour if you don't have any difficulty with puzzles or the achievements (I suggest look at your achievements when you start the game)

the puzzles are easy and different from another. they are like a collection of some unique and some cliche puzzles that are gathered in this game.

the art style, the soundtrack or the sound effects are really cute and unique.

if you think you don't want to pay too much for a short puzzle game then get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315888979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1622224156}
review:
La sencillez hecho juego.

Es un point & click isomÃ©trico. Con el botÃ³n izquierdo interactÃºas y con el derecho mueves la cÃ¡mara. Son los Ãºnicos controles que hay. El juego estÃ¡ construido en base a polÃ­gonos e interacciones con el entorno.

La historia es breve. Has "sufrido" un accidente y tienes que ayudar a unos buenos samaritanos que se han ofrecido a arreglar tu vehÃ­culo. Les ayudas y te vas. No hay mÃ¡s. No hay lÃ­neas de diÃ¡logo. No hay trasfondo dramÃ¡tico *casi*. La compaÃ±Ã­a que tienes es la de tu personaje, la banda sonora (muy tranquila y relajante) y los ruidos de lo que estÃ¡ pasando alrededor. Sin embargo, tampoco es que pase mucho.

Al contrario que se pueda pensar, no es para nada aburrido. Avanzas mediante puzzles con pistas que el entorno te da no de forma muy evidente. Los puzzles no estÃ¡n mal, a excepciÃ³n de uno porque a mÃ­ me ha parecido que la informaciÃ³n que me da es errÃ³nea a la forma que quiere que lo aplique. O serÃ© yo que no he sabido interpretarlo.

Es un juego para pasÃ¡rselo en una tarde tranquilamente. Ni exige, ni agobia. Pero te deja con buen sabor de boca.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026463611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1622181481}
review: If you enjoy puzzle games that are non-linear in terms of where you *can* go, but extremely linear in terms of where you *need* to go, which are also full of misleading or useless visual clues, then Pan-Pan might be for you. I'd say this game is unplayable without a walk-through, or WAY more patience for backtracking than I have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001224494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1621805341}
review: Very short but interesting. It's an environmental puzzle game and some of the puzzles are not obvious at all. Took me probably just over an hour to beat it. It's not for everyone but I love the art style. I think it's well worth it on sale if the art/puzzles interest you but not for full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094051583', 'num_games_owned': 3259, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1621490364}
review:
A very cute little puzzle game with no dialogue. I love the mood that that sets, but it does make a few things a bit confusing. Overall it was pretty easy to figure out in the end, but considering I played this at 1am, it did take a second. I love the art in this game, especially the character designs! I definitely plan to go back some time and get the 2 achievements I missed (I didn't talk to the frog, just fed him, rip). Only one of the achievements felt like a bit of a grind. The other one that could be considered a grind still only took less than a minute hah. 
I feel like the price can be considered steep for the amount of gameplay I got out of it, and personally would only recommend it on sale. However, I'm sure a lot of work went into the game and think the devs should be paid accordingly :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197988012862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 326, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1606649157}
review:
Fantastic short open-world puzzle game!

Seriously, this is great! You're solving stuff in an open world to find the parts you need to get your spaceship back (it literally crashed through the 4th wall at the beginning); a very fun thing is that a) there are creatures in this world who take part in the puzzles, and b) the world changes as you affect it. The sad thing is that it's short, about 2 hours if you don't idle, but very satisfying to play and solve. The puzzles don't increase in difficulty; you solve one and that's it, each puzzle is unique. You'll mainly need observation and some lateral thinking.

Most puzzles are very logical, and the game gives you clues on how to solve them. If it seems impossible, it probably is right now; look somewhere else first! Something may come up that helps you!

Things I wish I had known beforehand:
* Vases don't break if you hit them. I had played an RPG before where they do, and was afraid to hit them. You can!
* You can get the fish; in fact, you need the fish.
The latter information is also hinted at in the DLC manual; other than that, the manual not very useful (but quite enjoyable), except it has a map that can come in handy if you tend to get disoriented easily.

Expect about 2 hours of discovering a small world, and learn to solve puzzles through careful observation and lateral thinking! If you're  thinking now, "this might be fun", it probably is!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072544351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1592155286}
review: A wonderful little puzzle game. Pan-pan is an exploration game that consists of one large level. All the puzzles are connected, which makes for a unique experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198406497515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1603857791}
review: Very cute graphics, adorable character design, as well as lovely sound effects and beautiful music. Biggest drawback is lack of any sort of tutorial/control introduction. The game has no text and relies on visual cues. While the puzzles are fun once you realize that's what they are, its a bit jarring for a game to not let you know, well, anything. After looking up the first few puzzles the rest were fun to solve on my own and made me feel pretty accomplished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082975743', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1603840844}
review: Giving  a thumbs up, even after being horribly frustrated by my lack of intuition for this game. Lots to love - the graphics, characters, humour and yes, even a few of the puzzles - but getting anywhere at the start took forever.  There is a way more that doesn't need to be done than there is to BE done, and I'll leave it at that. All in all, I enjoyed the game and was disappointed when it was done. Not a large game, only a handful of real puzzles, but that still took me almost 7 hrs to solve. Recommended, but be prepared to do some head banging on walls while playing and some really DOH moments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079209755', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1603352803}
review:
Textbook definition of "Short and Sweet"
Finished in about 2 hours, very cute and endearing, if you have a knack for exploring/discovering and don't mind some puzzles along the way this game is perfect for ya.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041108401', 'num_games_owned': 1219, 'num_reviews': 496, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1601243147}
review:
When I purchased this game it seemed to me as an open world puzzle game where there are several independant puzzles. But in fact you can't solve any puzzle on itself. The whole world needs to be done in an exact order, otherwise you have no chance of solving anything. And there is no way to know which order you have to do it, it's just pure try and error. Maliciously the devs decided to put several puzzles in front of your nose which can't be solved and placing the puzzle you need to do first further down the road. Try and error combined with a relative large world in regards of the character's movement speed leads to frustrating long searching for the next right puzzle in the sequence without getting anywhere. 
I very much like that this game doesn't hold hands / doesn't explain and lets you find out for yourself / explore. Also I like its art style, cute characters and that it's short (30 minutes if you know where to go). But disrespecting the players time by making a long corridor game disguised as an open world makes me not suggest this. I highly suggest to watch a walkthrough video to just get directions for the next right puzzle in the sequence and then solve it by yourself. This way you can be sure, that the puzzle is solvable. It's way too annoying to waste time and thought on something impossible. 

If you longed for an open world puzzle game with several independant puzzles try A Monster's Expedition by Draknek.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063019594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1596292756}
review: nice

author: {'steamid': '76561197960364747', 'num_games_owned': 882, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1594585128}
review: Both frustration and awe in a short little package. Overall I really liked the game but the game often doesn't give you enough feedback about the effect of your actions, making it hard to even figure out what you're supposed to do. I do like that you have to figure things out but less trial & error would have been nice. But I kinda forgive all that since it is short, beautiful and sounds lovely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025016532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1593106221}
review:
It's short and sweet, with cute (if simple) graphics and a decent little soundtrack, and most importantly (to me) for a puzzle game, it is largely solvable without a walkthrough, i.e.  after a little headscratching and maybe even leaving the game alone for a day or so, you'll probably figure out how to get past some conundrum that was blocking you.

You play a strange little alien who crash lands on a strange world and must attempt to navigate the environment and solve puzzles to rebuild your ship.  

There is very little else to say about the game.  It is very enjoyable, the puzzles are largely logical and can be figured out with a bit of thought, and it is pleasing to the eyes and ears.

I can definitely recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061453220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1588189740}
review:
Graphics? Amazing! (Reminds me a lot of Monument Valley)
Music? Soothing!
Sound effects? Funny!
Puzzles? Directly from hell. Without a guide impossible.
Controller support would have been nice.
Anyway: Recommended. Buy it in sale.

Tip: If you want to put something down without a dedicated place, click on the object itself. Would have helped me a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198988070537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1588161603}
review:
Very cute and at times very frustrating! It's a game that really made me think which I really liked and it was very immersive, which was helped by the fact that there are no written or spoken words - although it would have been nice to have a "hint" option or an instruction or two as there were some puzzles that I simply could not have figured out on my own. In the end I'm glad I did look up some hints because it helped me to keep enjoying the game, rather than getting too frustrated and giving up.

It took me a little while to really get into, but I'm really glad I've played Pan-Pan. It is only about a three hour game, so I'm glad I got it at a hefty discount as I think the asking price is very steep for what it is. I would recommend it, but I'd also suggest waiting for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334086020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1588085915}
review: Pan-Pan is a wonderful game if you want to challenge your problem solving skills. When you solve your first puzzle in this game it gives you a feeling of pride. The puzzles in this game can be challenging at times, but with enough perseverance anything is possible. My only complaints are with the sound and the puzzles. The sound sometimes becomes crackly, and the puzzles can be a bit cheap on how you are supposed to solve them. For the most part I enjoyed my experience; there were a few annoyances, but the good outweighs the bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147739317', 'num_games_owned': 1567, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1587925341}
review:
[h1]Intro[/h1]
Considering the fine art of this game I decided to purchase without reading the reviews or checking the gameplay. The art style of this game reminds me of Monument Valley (available on Android and iOS). Playing games like Monument Valley, Limbo, Inside etc did set the bar high for me already.

Coming back to this game, I'll just quickly categorize the things as Pros and Cons, easy to read and will add more details in words (without any spoilers).

[h1]Pros[/h1]
Overall, I loved the graphics and the music is soothing to the ears.

[list]
    [*] Graphics, very nice
    [*] Music, very pleasant, but also some parts of it seems be copied from Monument Valley (like when you reach to a checkpoint)
[/list]

I think that is pretty much it to the above.

[h1]Cons[/h1]
This is going to be a long list. To be honest, I expected a lot out of this game, to be fun and tricky but it lacks a lot of things.

[list]
    [*] No tutorial, absolutely no idea on what needs to be done.
    [*] Being a puzzle game, it opens a lot of areas of the map instead of sequentially loading, thus, making it more confusing. Now I know that some of these puzzles are independent, but still it makes no sense to me.
    [*] Somethings are way more complex than you can even imagine it as a solution.
    [*] Some puzzles literally makes no sense to me. [spoiler]A couple of them I noticed were annoying because the shapes don't even match to the objects (seemed more like a bug to me)[/spoiler]
[/list]

Overall, the experience I was looking for was a pleasant one but instead it annoyed me. I had to refer to walk through guides back to back just to complete this game. Now I may be dumb enough to understand the logic of this game but it was hell of a confusing one for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061225352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1587765263}
review:
A nice calm and relaxing puzzle game to play, one that I will probably play again at some point in the future. 

The gameplay is very basic which is nice because you can have tea and biscuits whilst playing as you only need the mouse. All the environments in the game are artistically crafted and look superb. Lovely music creates the tranquil atmosphere when you're exploring. 

Although the puzzles seem very obscure and bizarre, they were easier to understand after lots of thinking outside the box. I think the game inspires you to use your imagination and I like that.

I would definitely recommend trying this game.

review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review [/h1]

Pan-Pan is a game developed by Spelkraft and published by Might and Delight

The game offers some nice graphics, although some ugly glitches here and there, it is pleasant all the same

Pan-Pan overall, however, is a fun game to play, and it does get boring if being played for a long time, but is an really good adventure game to play in short bursts!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040882512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1554776451}
review:
Pan-Pan was published but, I found out too late, not developed by Might and Delight. Itâ€™s another game that thinks that using words is blase and I have to say of all the indie subgenres trending right now the whole â€˜refuse to tell you whatâ€™s going on because they for some reason think thatâ€™s inferiorâ€™ is quickly becoming my least favorite. Pan-Pan really suffers for it, too. It claims itâ€™s an open-world, but itâ€™s actually not â€” you have to complete each area in a very particular order, but it doesnâ€™t goddamn tell you, so youâ€™ll often end up wasting huge amounts of time trying to complete uncompletable puzzles. Thereâ€™s also no map, so it gets super obnoxious trying to figure out where you have and havenâ€™t been and how to get where you need to go. You basically have to accidentally stumble into doing things the right way which is not how you game design. Itâ€™s almost unplayable without a guide, and itâ€™s not doing anything that makes it worth trudging through with a guide.

On top of all that, loose controls makes some of the puzzles that require walking out patterns a nightmare, and thereâ€™s a lot of story/gameplay dissonance (I canâ€™t push down the crumbling door by ramming it, but I canâ€¦ with a stick?).

author: {'steamid': '76561198064186554', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1562308339}
review: This game is simply wonderful. Granted, I'm a sucker for the art style and overall atmosphere/mood. Some of the "puzzles" are pretty hard to figure out, though. There was one part in particular that I had to use a walkthrough for, otherwise I would have literally been wondering around for hours making zero progress. Other than that, my experience was positive overall! If you're a fan of the Monument Valley games, then I really think you'll enjoy this little gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107866105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1550946991}
review:
Encontrei esse jogo em uma promoÃ§Ã£o e acabei adquirindo ele principalmente por ter uma arte muito parecida com o Monument Valley, um jogo para Android/iOS de puzzles que curto bastante.

Bom, mesmo nÃ£o sendo um jogo semelhante ao mencionado, Pan-Pan possui puzzles mais â€œsimplesâ€ e uma boa trilha sonora, o que torna um game bem calmo e relaxante. Outro ponto positivo Ã© o seu Ã³timo desempenho em computadores antigos/fracos.

Entretantoâ€¦ O jogo Ã© um pouco confuso por nÃ£o apresentar qualquer tipo de histÃ³ria ou descriÃ§Ã£o. VocÃª precisa entender com base no que apenas Ã© apresentado. PorÃ©m, uma vez que vocÃª finaliza o game, caso venha a joga-lo novamente jÃ¡ sabe onde ir e o que fazer.

AliÃ¡s, falando em â€œhistÃ³riaâ€, vocÃª consegue terminar o game em duas horas ou menos.

Considerando o valor que paguei pelo game (R$ ~5,00) e seu conjunto geral, eu recomendo para quem gosta de um bom e rÃ¡pido jogo de puzzle. Mas, por R$ ~25,00? Acredito que nÃ£o.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979795898', 'num_games_owned': 656, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1537940139}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024116754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1536928949}
review:
A gentle puzzle/exploration game about a stranded traveller fixing her ship and making friends.
Visually reminiscent of Monument Valley, with Nordic/Moomin-esque style touches and characters (e.g. it looks lovely).
The game was clearly designed for play on a tablet, but is well adapted to PC.

I completed the game in one sitting with a playtime of around 2Â½ hours, I only got stuck a couple of times and managed to get myself unstuck with a little experiementation. Guides are not necessary if you're patient.

An additional playthrough was required to get an achievement I missed the first time around. Once you know what you're doing it only takes about half an hour to play it through again.

Purchased for -80% of retail price in a steam sale and for that price I was very satisfied with the game length and quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1530818353}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Un petit jeu d'exploration/puzzle. Les graphismes sont mignons, les crÃ©atures aussi. Les animations du personnage principal ont un je-ne-sais quoi de satisfaisant quand elle court ou monte une Ã©chelle Ã  toute vitesse. Le petit "cloc" quand on appuie sur un bouton aussi. Parmis les bons points, le path finding est l'un des meilleurs que j'ai jamais vu. OÃ¹ qu'on clique, le personnage ira (si c'est possible), et si le dÃ©cor change entre temps (par exemple, un pont qui se baisse), le personange changera de direction pour aller au plus court. Tout simplement excellent !

Les puzzles sont pour la majoritÃ© simples, mÃªme si un ou deux peuvent demander un peu de rÃ©flexion. Un des seuls points nÃ©gatifs du jeu, c'est ce dÃ©faut qu'ont certains point&click : une action ne va se dÃ©clencher que si certaines conditions sont rÃ©unies, alors qu'elles n'ont AUCUN rapport avec ce qui se dÃ©clenche ([spoiler]ici, le robot ne creusera le tunnel que si on a la batterie avec la croix bleue... alors que Ã§a n'a aucun rapport de cause Ã  effet.[/spoiler]).

Le jeu n'a absolument aucun dialogue (ni texte, ni dessins), et parvient tout de mÃªme Ã  nous faire comprendre ce qu'il faut faire. C'est Ã§a des puzzles de qualitÃ© !

[h1]RejouabilitÃ©, achievements[/h1]

Le jeu est trÃ¨s court, se termine en 2h. J'ai passÃ© un peu plus de temps car j'avais manquÃ© un des achievements lors de mon premier run. Aucun n'est compliquÃ© Ã  obtenir.

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Bien que court, le jeu est vraiment bon. Un exemple Ã  suivre sur la faÃ§on de prÃ©senter des puzzles !

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente, je n'ai rencontrÃ© aucun problÃ¨me.

OS: Linux Mint 18.3 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.
Screens : Dualscreen, 1x 4K & 1x 1920x1200, un seul screen X.

review: Un gioco forse troppo corto ma molto molto bello. I luoghi da esplorare sono rilassanti: nessuna fretta, nessun pericolo, solo enigmi neanche troppo complicati che danno molta soddisfazione quando vengono superati. Lo consiglio assolutamente!

review:
is nice but kinda short and lacking content, considering base price of the game

- puzzle is nice and actually harder than I thought it would be,

will not recommend buying at full price, so wait for sale

author: {'steamid': '76561198184897393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 653, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1528729906}
review:
A nice adventure puzzle game.  The area to explore may be a little small, but it is enjoyable and ripe for a speed-run.  Most of the puzzles are great and fun to solve, while (at least) 1 will probably leave you scratching your head, furrowing your eyebrows, and needing a break. The sounds throughout really add to the atmosphere and are entertaining to hear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079335824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1528375877}
review:
[h1]Pan-Pan[/h1]

[i]Pan-Pan is a very sweet, nicely made, short puzzle game in a mini open world. You must find your way around the island and solve puzzles as you progress, you need to collect and place the missing blocks and batteries in there right places, these will help get your space ship back up and running, so you can leave the island you crashed on. Game has no narration, so can be a bit confusing to start, but with some thought I managed to get through the game, and it really was not difficult. The clues to solve the puzzles are very close by. I really enjoyed my time with this game, sadly its very short. [/i]

[i]I thinks the RRP is just to much to ask for such a short game, wait for a decent sale OR buy it now at the 80% off, before sale ends. Its a nice little game, and plays very well with just the mouse only.[/i] :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198050853569', 'num_games_owned': 3422, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1623539794}
review:
I donâ€™t play point-and-click puzzle games very often, but when I do, there must be something pulling me in, something asking me to devote my â€œtoo-trivially spentâ€ yet â€œonly-thing-that-mattersâ€ time in its essence, and then there was Pan-Pan. The minute I saw the trailer and witnessed the main character joyfully running to and fro in a beautiful yet minimalist art style I knew right away; I donâ€™t know what this game is about, I donâ€™t care what type it is, I donâ€™t care about any of it as long as I get to experience an hour or two with the heroine extraordinaire that is Pan-Pan. I donâ€™t quite know how to explain it. There was joy and warm fussy feelings, then there was purchase. Usually Iâ€™m a much conservative gamer when it comes to my purchasing power and after meticulous research and pricing optimization I conclude (sometimes months in advance) if the game is worth purchasing at all. Alas, I pulled the trigger.
This game is more art than video game. Itâ€™s not groundbreaking or stupefying in any one single endeavor, but what it is, is beautiful â€¦ and sometimes it is harder to create something with soul than an empty, repetitive experience (cough*fifa, cod*cough). Regardless, if you know anything about Might and Delight then you know what they publish, and if you like their games then be safe in knowing that the artsy, minimalist, outside-of-the-box thinking is still strong here, a trademark that I hope never disappears from their work. Thank you MaD! (Fitting abbreviation might I add jeje).

author: {'steamid': '76561198076352345', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1519134496}
review:
Pan-Pan was a short and sweet game. The game only took me about 2 hours to complete, and I did so all in one sitting. The game keeps things simple and discovery is the name of the game. You are given nothing at the start of the game bar a few helpful locals indicating places to put objects where objects there are not. A few points in the game I spent roaming the world scratching my head thinking "Where the fuck do I go!" However, when I realised the solution I got that shot of puzzle solving excitement. Overall I was impressed with the way Pan-Pan put it's puzzles together. 

I would recommend this game for anyone looking to spend an evening taking a break from their action packed library and are searching for a good game to scratch that puzzle itch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997925177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 331, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1515439338}
review:
This is not a game. This is an insult.

I did things. Calling it 'puzzle solving' is giving games with puzzles a bad rep. You pick up the square thing and put it in the square hole. Repeatedly. I kept putting random things into random receptacles and stuff happened, yay. Note how there are no guides for the game? You won't need one - just keep doing obvious things. 

And just when you think "Now I understand the puzzle mechanics! The tutorial is over and I can start for real!" - You get "The End" I beat the game in under 2 hours. I don't mind short games, but those were incredibly boring hours, so in this case I do mind.

The horrible isometric/no perspective camera with couterintitive controls doesn't even matter at this point.

Even the weeping soundtrack is an extended middle finger to the buyer: The whole game has 215 MB on your Disk. More than half of that is a single mp3 with a running time of 50 minutes. One file.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995669628', 'num_games_owned': 1584, 'num_reviews': 534, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1515165001}
review:
[b] Pan-Pan [/b] is a very beautiful puzzle game that uses point&click controls. While the music and sound effects are fantastic, the story is told through charming visuals instead of dialogue. There is no deep plot so you don't really need any exposition. Also, Pan-Pan has a very good animation quality compared to similar games in the genre. Once I got the ability to smack characters with a stick I had some genuine laughs. The puzzles are definitely challenging but I don't have any issues with the game in general.

Our character crashes in her flying balloon and now has to find the parts to repair it. Majority of the game consists of memory and pressure based puzzles. You can rotate the camera which is very important because clues could be on the walls. I beat the game blindly around 2 hours and got most of the achievements. For $6-12 game it is a little bit shorter than I expected. There are several pretty environments but not as much to explore as the description would suggest. Most of the puzzles were creative, sometimes utilizing very interesting solutions. As far as the logic goes I did not have many problems (maybe 2-3 strange moments).

Visually the game has a lot of attention to detail. The use of very colourful environments made it a joy to explore. Music was relaxing and some of the sound effects were just adorable. As a whole, the presentation was good even when it comes to basic functions. The ending needed to be more substantial though. 

[h1] Final Thoughts 8/10 [/h1]

Pan-Pan is not the easiest puzzle game and it won't hold your hand entire time. I did get frustrated on few occasions. The hardest part is figuring out the first few steps but then it gets reasonably straightforward.  Although it is a little short for the price. It has a good quality overall so if you like cute adventures I would definitely recommend it.


...........................................................................................................

author: {'steamid': '76561197963765330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1507426227}
review: short and sweet, great art style. I thought a few things could have been designed more clearly but I was never stuck for too long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269082534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1524735104}
review: This game has THE most satisfying sound design I have ever experienced. I can't put my finger on it but it's just so good ??? It's also gorgeous with a really charming artstyle and characters. I can't say much about the puzzles, because I'm terrible at point- and click games, but the time I spent on not being able to solve the puzzles was just as enjoyable as the actual solving. You know a game has done something right when just walking around and hitting stuff with a stick is satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145398531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1502668626}
review:
Pan-Pan is an adorable game and it runs smoothly on my old laptop. It's super relaxing and the puzzles make you think. It's satisfying to solve and the characters and style are unique and beautiful. 
It's overall a simple and fun game for those who like puzzle adventures and no dialogue.

I recommend this game to people who fancy relaxing puzzle games, and exploration.

review: The Game is very short but offers an enjoyable experince with puzzle a delightful art style and a great sound track, with a simple control scheme and an fast past character getting around is a breeze there will be a few confusing moments in when you find your self suck explore explore explore all up i found the game to be fantastic with a score of 10/10 if i had any negative comments it would be the cost of the game over the time spent playing it as its not very long so what for sale if that's a problem for your  wallet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259047392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1478999507}
review: I love this game. The art is wonderful and the puzzles and simple but fun. The developer is a rad dude and he fixed a bug that broke my game within days of me reporting it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069634986', 'num_games_owned': 3362, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1493391921}
review:
[b]Pan-Pan[/b] is a great-looking indie adventure game with minimalistic graphics, interesting puzzles and a surprisingly deep story.
If this review is too long for you, I suggest you only read the first paragraph about the game's content and the final verdict at the end.

Check out this review and many others on Save or Quit: http://saveorquit.com/2017/05/04/review-pan-pan/

[h1]What is happening in the game:[/h1]
You fly across the universe on your pretty little spaceship. Nothing could go wrong, right? Wrong. Your spaceship crashes and you're stuck in a place full of puzzles and cute graphics. To fix your spaceship, you have to get a few special pieces, which can be found by completing all the puzzles.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
    [*][b]Graphics[/b] | I'll just start with the most eye-catching aspect of the game, which is how the game looks. If you haven't taken a look at the screenshots yet, let me tell you this: Pan-Pan looks absolutely beautiful. Everything looks minimalistic and it really makes you love indie games. 
    [*][b]Controls[/b] | I really like the controls, they are really intuitive and guiding the character around it really. You can simply click and drag to make the girl follow your cursor. Alternatively, you can click to your desired destination and wait for her to arrive there. You can rotate the camera by moving your mouse while holding the right mouse button. WASD keys can also be used to rotate the camera.
    [*][b]Puzzles[/b] | There aren't many of them (less than 10), but puzzles are obviously what this game is all about. Most puzzles are equally difficult and also equally enjoyable. If you've played games like Lume and Machinarium, this game has approximately the same kind of puzzles included.
    [*][b]Story[/b] | I wasn't expecting much of a story in Pan-Pan, but I was pleasantly surprised when I finished. Although you don't get to discover the story a lot while solving the puzzles, the beginning and the final cutscene made an impression on me, but I can't reveal much without spoilers, sadly.
    [*][b]Soundtrack[/b] | The soundtrack is simple, charming and relaxing - just like the visual part of the game. Not much more can be said in this paragraph, but it might be worth mentioning that the soundtrack is also available for purchase on Steam for $3.
    [*][b]Wordlessness[/b] | Apart from a few basic necessary words in the main menu and when trying to save your progress, this game uses no words at all. This leads to really cute animations when you try to interact with other characters - wiggling, jumping, mumbling sounds ... it's really lovely!
    [*][b]Achievements[/b] | If you're an achievement hunter, this game is for you. The achievements aren't that hard and they also offer some replayability value, which is great. Even the "grinding" achievements don't require you to do much work - it's all achievable within 10 minutes at most.
    [*][b]OS Support[/b] | As any game in the modern era should, this game works on all three major operating systems: Windows, MacOS and Linux/SteamOS. As I've heard, all three versions work great.
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
    [*][b]Difficulty[/b] | The puzzles themselves are not extremely difficult, but on one puzzle I got completely stuck. Completely. I had absolutely no idea what to do and the game itself wasn't very helpful with that. There are no clues, no hints, no help, nothing. You're on your own (unless you know the word "walkthrough" and know how to use Youtube) and if you find a puzzle difficult, there isn't much you can do. Except if you're willing to pay $3 to get a manual, but I don't know if that's really worth your money.
    [*][b]3D Terrain[/b] | This is a minor issue, but having this minimalistic artstyle in the game causes some hills and obstacles to be invisible. This is because a lot of shadows that would normally be seen are not present and the obstacle may appear to be the same colour as the ground from a certain angle. Because of this, you sometimes try to walk to a certain direction but keep hitting an invisible wall (which turns out to be not so invisible after you change the camera angle).
    [*][b]Length[/b] | Depending on how you play, this game should take about 2-3 hours to complete. In my opinion, this is a bit short, especially since the price is $13. They should add at least one more hour worth of content to make the price justifiable.
[/list]

[h1]The final verdict:[/h1]
Overall, I can recommend this game for sure. I'm quite bothered about the short playtime needed to complete the story, especially since the price is not very low for an indie game of such genre. Otherwise, I had a lot of fun in this game. The puzzles are quite intriguing and rewarding. The graphics are obviously amazing, almost everything you see is appropriate for a desktop background. Interactions with the world are cute and at times funny, which really does make you love this game even more.
To conclude: if you're a fan of indie puzzle games, give this game a try, but you should probably wait until it's discounted.

With love,
BirdCute

[quote]Note that my copy of this game was obtained for free for reviewing purposes. However, this did not affect the quality and objectivity of the reviewing process.[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197971636562', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1489152165}
review:
Pan-Pan is a good puzzle game. It's definitely has a distinct art style. It's probably its strongest selling point.

Puzzles are okay in Pan-Pan. Not really challenging. They're quite simple to be honest.

The biggest let down though is the length of the game. It's very short. Especially for the asking price.

I would recommend to wait for a good sale for the game. I don't say it often for indie games but you'll be better off if you buy it at least at 50 discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319596134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1476737941}
review: Graphic is good, puzzles are solvable but not lame, characters are cute, and motions are excellent. The only thing that bothered me was short play time. I finished the game in 2 hours. Loved the colors used in the world, and liked music too. Just sad that it ended so fast. Maybe more story lines could have made it better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143484373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1474474125}
review:
A very charming little puzzle game! Loved the soundtrack and the atmosphere of the game. All the characters made adorable noises. There were a lot of wandering around wondering what to do, but it was fun to explore the surrounding. Some puzzles were quite hard but I liked that. I found the controls a bit frustrating, like putting items down or waiting for the character to walk around a long way since it's not possible to jump.

It's a short game but I think it's worth it's price. I really enjoyed it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978951943', 'num_games_owned': 1489, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1474283665}
review:
Pan-Pan ist eines dieser kleinen Abenteuer, die eine besondere AtmosphÃ¤re versprÃ¼hen, welche man schwer in Worte fassen kann. Man kÃ¶nnte dem Spiel EinflÃ¼sse vom Level-Design eines The Witness, ein Ã¤hnliches Setting eines PixelJunk Shooter und die visuelle PrÃ¤sentation eines Lovely Weather Weâ€™re Having zusprechen. Und doch ist es Spelkraft gelungen, eine ganz eigene homogene Spielwelt zu kreieren, mit vielen Ecken und Kanten, aber einer Menge PersonalitÃ¤t. Die RÃ¤tsel sind anspruchsvoll, aber stets zu lÃ¶sen. Ein Bug, den wir den Entwicklern meldet, wurde auch direkt wenige Tage spÃ¤ter gefixt. Einzig an der etwas kurzen Spielzeit bestÃ¼nde aufgrund des stolzen Preises Raum fÃ¼r Kritik. Wir wÃ¼rden uns freuen, erneut in diese Spielwelt abtauchen zu kÃ¶nnen.
// ganzer Test auf http://www.xtgamer.de/2016/09/19/im-test-pan-pan-spitzfindiges-raetseln-auf-fremden-planeten/

author: {'steamid': '76561198063693442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1473562099}
review:
Pan-Pan is a short but sweet puzzle game, with artistic visuals and music akin to those of Monument Valley. It'll only take you around 2 hours (at most) to complete it, but thatâ€™s perfect for this game. It shows you exactly what the game is about, sets you free to solve all the puzzles, and never overstays its welcome.

The moment you start a new game you are welcomed with delightful visuals, calming music, and a screen pure of any HUDs, text, or unnecessary cut scenes. Outside the menus, the game uses no words. Instead, it delivers its short story through the charactersâ€™ interactions and endearing sounds. Have I mentioned how charming the music is?

Visuals and sounds aside, the game delivers a fair number of puzzles, many of which involve moving objects around or pressing buttons. The puzzles are fairly easy, but not too easy. The game also displays some visual hints, enough to push you towards the right direction, but not too much that it annoyingly holds your hands. Youâ€™re free to walk around and solve the puzzles at your own pace and in any order. However, itâ€™ll become obvious a bit later into the game that you need to solve some puzzles before others to open up new routs or obtain items.

The game feels good while it lasts. You wonâ€™t spend much time squeezing your brain for solutions. There isnâ€™t any replay value. Itâ€™s nothing jaw-dropping. But thatâ€™s exactly what the game is about, sort of like drinking a nice cup of tea after a long day of work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968933384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1472509267}
review:
Pan-Pan is a nicely-styled environmental puzzle adventure.  It has a simple but endearing art style.  Controls are basic, and puzzles are fairly inuitive.  There is no inventory, other than some active and passive tools you acquire.  Unfortunately, there is not much content, perhaps 2-6 hours of gameplay with not much incentive for replay.  A pity, because I craved more puzzles and more of the world.  
Pros: Charm, style
Cons: Too short for full price
Summary:  Worth picking up, but wait for a discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025321979', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1472322889}
review: It's a short game but wonderfully designed and such a joy to play. The simple sounds, the ambient music, the exploration. I hope the developers continue to develop more games like this one! It's when I play games like these I'm happy there are indie developers out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970585058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1474742171}
review:
I'm a little undecided about this one. For the most part, I enjoyed it greatly; the graphics, atmosphere and other-worldliness of it all has massive appeal.
However;

- Some of the puzzle bits I found very obscure. Near the beginning of the game I spent over an hour wandering aimlessly about unable to make [i]any[/i] progress. Simply because I missed/misinterpreted the significance of two tiny things. In case you are also stuck, it's [spoiler]the fireflies in the mine, and the hexagon on the floor there[/spoiler].
- Even when I'd solved some of the puzzles I didn't really understand why. I mainly brute-forced the gems in the mine, for example; I've still no idea at all why the solution is correct.
- It's not readily apparent how to drop items. (Hint; click on the item itself, not the ground.)
- The controls are generally excellent; with great path-finding. However, the number of times I accidently went up and down the tower defies belief.
- As others have said, it's short. Even with the aimless wandering and ladder-climbing it only took me 3.5 hours. At the current price-point that does seem lacking in content. 

I'm leaving it as recommended, as for the most part it is a beautifully crafted, delightful game. To mark it as not recommended would be like kicking a puppy. But be wary of the above points, and if in doubt wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000939128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1472243692}
review:
At the instant when I saw an image of this game, i knew i wanted to get my hand on it.
Pan-pan is beautiful while being spectacularly simple visually, the amount of detail is quite low and everything seems so perfectly placed. The same goes the the orinal sound track that has some catchy tunes for the some moments but it's mostly ambiant music, add to that a neat sound design for the noise. It's a game that looks, sounds, and feels like Monument Valley. 

This is a good inspiration, that smartphone game was overall a good experience... but they copied THE bad parts of it too. While I'm delighted that the studio designed it without a single line of text to tell you where to go, it's not that hard once you figure out basic stuff. And you can be stuck because some trigger need to be activated and you have no clue about them, hopefully there are only a few in the game but it still is a frustation point.
Unlike Machinarium, an Amanita Design's game that narrates you a complete story without a single word, Pan-Pan is a simple pretext scenario with only two events : the space ship crashes on an unknown planet and ("spoiler alert") you go look for the parts in order to fly away... 
Finally, the game is freaking short. Two hour at most, I'm not kidding. You can genuinely buy the game full price, finish it, sell its card, and get a refund on Steam if you're that kind of jerk. 

I would still recommend it, but with extreme caution on the kind of player seeking advice. If all the things you read don't frighten you, you should give it a go. Otherwise, pass your way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031159903', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1473226170}
review:
Pan-Pan is beautiful. The style is similar to Journey with simple shapes and bright colors. I've really enjoyed playing it even though I am stuck on one eye puzzle that doesn't seem to want to be solved....

It's a solid fun game for only $12.99. I highly recommend getting it.
